review_blob:
Bottle bought from Mikkeller online shop, shared at home.
Appearance: black, minimal head. 
Aroma: vanilla, coffee, chocolate, caramel, licorice, mocca, leather, slight woody note.
Taste: heavy sweetness, medium and longlasting bitterness.
Palate: full body, thick and oily, sticky, long finish. Soft carbonation.
Overall: Vanilla dominating, very very sweet, balanced bitterness. Great nose on this one, but way too sweet for my tongue, close to sickening after a while, one bottle is more than enough.
beer_name: Mikkeller Beer Geek Vanilla Shake (Bourbon Edition)

review_blob: Golden color, small head. Low carb. Nose;caramel, fruit like apple and pear, wood. Taste; at first it feel like youre having a cider until the oakwood kicks in. Decent bitterness well integrated. Abv feel high, would have guessed higher that 8, but its not unpleasant in any way. Unusual beer, but interesting.

Cloudy yellow with a big white head. Not too strong on the nose. Taste is dominated by citrus, with wheat and floral notes. Faint coriander. Witbier not my prefered beerstyle, but this is not bad, refreshing and a pleasing sourness to it. Taste and smell fades rather quickly in the glass...

0,5l bottle, Matkroken store, Bergen.
-Apperance: Mahogny/Amber, white med. head. Clear.
-Aroma: Mild malt and some fruits.
-Palate: Medium mouthfill, medium carb, light/medium hoppiness.
-Taste: Malty, dark fruits, nutty, slight metallic note
-Overall: Nice and well balanced at 4%. Not a lot going one here, but nothing offpulling. Honest beer.
